job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Toronto, ON
pros: Ability to move around and endless opportunities to pick up shifts
cons:
-No plan or acknowledgment to fix the huge nursing crisis
-after six months new RPNs make the same as an RPN with 10+ years experience 
-treats staff like just a number, management and higher ups have zero empathy
-extremely unsafe working environments 
-extremely unsafe nurse:patient ratios and the response is always “well it’s corporation wide so deal with it”
-everything is politics and budget cuts and the patients are suffering
-during the pandemic our rights (what very little we have) were completely revoked and nurses had no rights to refuse, vacations were cancelled, nurses were pulled to other units with zero orientation and had to do things outside their scope of practice
-our voices and cries for help are listened to but we are not heard, nothing ever gets resolved

job_title: Decision Support Analyst in Whitby, ON
pros:
Qualified team members that you can learn a lot from. 

You can learn a lot about how Hospitals are run and the kinds of decisions that take place. 

The work is very meaningful since end users really need the data for various strategic decisions.
cons:
Extremely heavy work load. 

Extremely difficult to figure out which fields need to be used from the database.

Database has many many intricacies that you need to be aware of, otherwise, the data will be inaccurate.

Although the team was polite, the established culture seems to be minimal socialization. Difficult to feel welcomed or valued part of the team.
